heisig_chinese_memo: Now the magic wand is mysteriously floating below the ceiling.
heisig_constituent: below, one, ceiling, magic wand, augury, divining rod
heisig_story: Here we see our famous miraculous magic wand hanging, all on its own, below the ceiling, as you probably already guessed would happen. In addition to giving us two new kanji, the two shapes given in this and the preceding frame also serve to fix the use of the primitives for ceiling and floor, by drawing our attention successively to the line standing above and below the primitive element to which it is related.

WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: There's a toe below ground.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: So, where is the toe now? It's below ground. Imagine yourself digging it out, and thinking... ugh, why does it have to be below ground like this? So irritating. Will I be able to sew it back on in time to save it?
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: You keep digging for the toe below the ground, and instead of hitting a toe you hit something hard and metallic. You keep digging and digging around it, but it's huge. Turns out, you found yourself a car (ã‹). Keep digging until you unearth the car. Inside, you find the toe you were looking for.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: There's another useful on'yomi reading that just isn't useful enough for you to learn now. That reading is ã’, but we're only going to worry about that much, much later when you have to learn one or two vocab words that read ä¸‹ as ã’. That's the problem with really common kanji - too many readings.

humanum_full_description_en:
Oracle is placed under an arc with a short picture to express the meaning of " down ". Because of the inconvenience of the engraving, I changed the arc to make the horizontal painting later. "Shuowen": "Qie, the bottom also. Refers to things. Next, the seal script." Duan Yucai's commentary changed the ancient text of " Shuowen " to " ğ „Ÿ ". " ğ „Ÿ " is written according to the oracle bone inscriptions and early gold characters, but in order to avoid mixing with the characters "ä¸Š" and "äºŒ", one more vertical pen was added to write "ä¸‹" in the late Spring and Autumn Period. Therefore, the ancient writings of the Six Kingdoms in the Warring States Period were no longer written " ğ „Ÿ ". In addition, Chu texts are mostly placed on top of "xia" without adding a short horizontal painting pen.

" Xia " and " Xia " in the oracle bone inscriptions are opposite. Xu Zhongshu: "Up refers to God, and down refers to the gods of the earth." "Complete Collection" 7428: "Xia Shang Ruo (Promise), Accept (Give) Me and (Bless)", means get The promise of the earth and God grants me blessing (Liu Xinglong). See " on ". In addition, the word "Xia Shi" is commonly used in Oracle bone inscriptions, which is opposite to "Shang Shi". Xu Zhongshu refers to both as the masters of the Shangxian kings, as in Tunnan 1115: "Xia Shi Wu Lao" refers to the use of five sacrifices. Sacrifice comes as shown below.

The character "ä¸‹" in bronze inscriptions is used as a locality word, and is used to refer to the lower realm. Fan Sheng ğ£ª• Gai: "Guang Qi Jue's grandson is in the next", refers to your descendants who are greatly enlightened in the world. There is the word "xiaguan" in the inscriptions, which is the official residence of the Wei, and it is seen in the 35th year Ding. There is also "Xiasong" in the inscriptions in bronze, which is the name of a place, and its geographic location is unknown. Chang Tsang: "Mu Wangcai (in) Xiachen ã¡´(å±…)" refers to Mu Wang's temporary residence in Xiachen.

The word "ä¸‹" in handed down documents can be used as a word of self-humility to the venerable. On the other hand, " Xia " is extended from low position to a verb, which means to descend, such as the following snow. The other then extended the reference to attack, such as the "Warring States Policy. "Qi Ce Six": "Swallows attack Qi and take more than seventy cities, but Ju and Jimo can't get under."
humanum_short_description_en: Synopsis: The oracle bone inscriptions are opposite to the word "ä¸Š". The long picture is used as the standard, and the short picture indicates that the part is below. The original meaning is below.

xiÃ 
The position is lower, opposite to "upper": the lower layer. Next paragraph.
Low-level: lower level. Inferior. Xiacheng (Buddhist term, generally refers to the mediocre state of literature and art or inferior quality). Lower Liba people (referring to popular literature and art, often opposed to "Yangchun Baixue").
Aspect, orientation: agree on both.
Later in order or time: scroll down. Next time. Lower limit.
From a high place to a low place, landing: down the mountain. get off. dismount. Release.
Make a landing: Half-mast. Play chess.
Enter: Go to the sea.
Delivery: the next book.
End of daily work or study at the specified time: off work. Dismissal.
Qianci: Next. Subordinate.
Issue: Order.
Conquer: Take down.
Unloading: unloading. Drop his gun.
Use, invest energy: work hard.
Give in: Disagreement.
Make judgments: draw conclusions.
Quantifier, refers to the number of actions: hit three times.
Used behind nouns (a. means inside, such as "Xinxia", "yanxia"; b. means when a certain time period, such as "jiexia", "year under").
Used after the verb (a. means relationship, such as "teaching" and "cultivating"; b. means completion or result, such as "laying a foundation"; c. used in conjunction with "come" and "go" to indicate trend or continuation, Such as "go on", "stop").
Less than: no less than two hundred people.
Animal production: chickens lay eggs.
